page.title: 02Recent changes, Mawdesley
page.content: During the last 30 years,many new houses have been built in Mawdesley, increasing the population by a third. There is a greater variety of jobs;many professional people travel to towns to work.There has been a decline in rural occupations.Fewer people work on the land and in the local basket industry. The new village hall has provided a centre for community life.More people take part in sports and games,enjoying increased hours of leisure. The population of Eccleston has doubled over the last thirty years. There was much opposition to the building of houses on farmland known as Long Meadows.The farmhouse,Red House, built in 1673, is still occupied,but is no longer a farm.
